name: Michal Babinski
tagline:
Building clinical-grade genomics pipelines
that turn raw sequences into answers.
statement: What the future holds nobody can tell. But it's important to stay curious and to challenge your approach to problem solving. As long as this world remains human, I will remain committed to acting ethically and staying true to the mission of creating a better world.

about.heading:
From raw reads
to *real impact.*
columns: I build end-to-end bioinformatics pipelines — from reads QC through variant calling to production deployment. My work in pathogen surveillance at national labs and genomics companies has meant writing code where correctness isn't optional, it's essential for tangible impact.

With a background spanning molecular genetics, machine learning, and cloud infrastructure, I'm most at home at the intersection of biology and software engineering — where a well-crafted pipeline can reshape how we understand disease.

skills.items: WGS variant calling, SNV/INDEL analysis, assembly, functional annotation, pathogen classification
Nextflow, WDL/Terra, Docker, GitHub Actions CI/CD
Claude Code, agentic AI tooling, BERT embeddings, deep mutational scanning models

experience.title: Senior Bioinformatics Developer
experience.description: Architecting clinical-grade WGS pipelines for pathogen detection. Building production Python packages, classification databases, and cloud infrastructure across GCP and AWS.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: Built backend REST APIs and PostgreSQL schemas for a civic technology platform. Deployed multi-environment infrastructure with CI/CD on Heroku and AWS.

experience.title: Bioinformatics Software Developer
experience.description: Developed containerized multi-omics workflows. Trained ML models for SARS-CoV-2 variant prediction using BERT protein embeddings and deep mutational scanning data.

projects.title: Pathogen WGS Pipelines (Public Health Bioinformatics)
projects.description: End-to-end workflows for whole-genome sequencing pathogen detection — from reads QC to assembly to variant calling with automated validation frameworks. Built out for Virusal, Bacterial, and Fungal pathogens.

projects.title: SARS-CoV-2 Variant Classifier
projects.description: BERT-based protein embedding model for lineage classification and binding affinity prediction of Spike protein variants using deep mutational scanning data.

projects.title: Pathogen Surveillence Automation Sofware
projects.description: Built out and architected automation library for quichly setting up and deploying workflow and data orchestration for different pathogen surviellence networks allowing for real time insights into organism evolution.
